Event.name: Surrendering_possession
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Surrenderer</fen> is compelled to transfer a <fen>Theme</fen> to a <fen>Recipient</fen>.
<ex>Shortly after <fex name="Surrenderer">the boy</fex> <t>surrendered</t> <fex name="Theme">the gun</fex>, the three remaining warriors made a rush for liberty.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Surrenderer">He</fex> <fex name="Time">finally</fex> <t>surrendered</t> <fex name="Theme">the item</fex> <fex name="Time">after cops and Secret Service agents showed up at his home Saturday</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Surrenderer">D?Augustino</fex> <t>yielded</t> <fex name="Theme">the weapon</fex> <fex name="Recipient">to Herrick</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Surrenderer
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The person compelled to transfer the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Recipient
Arg.definition: <def-root>The entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Theme
Arg.definition: <def-root>The object that changes possession.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Surrenderer</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes a proposition from which the surrendering event logically follows.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Surrenderer</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Purpose</fen> for which the <fen>Surrenderer</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Surrenderer</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Manner</fen> is the manner in which the <fen>Surrenderer</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Circumstances</fen> describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the Surrendering event itself and any of its participants.
<ex>John <t>surrendered</t> the gun <fex name="cir">with everybody looking on in stunned silence</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Period_of_iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE modifies a clause with an iterative interpretation, which may be signified by the simple present tense on the main verb.</def-root>

Arg.name: Event_description
Arg.definition: <def-root>In general, this FE is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole. There are two somewhat distinct subgroups of sentence modifiers that cover this function.</def-root>

Arg.name: Re-encoding
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame.</def-root>

Arg.name: Communicative_force
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates the <fen>Communicative_force</fen> or authority with which the target operates (often denoted by words such as "officially," "formally," "technically," etc.). </def-root>

Arg.name: Particular_iteration
Arg.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. </def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. </def-root>

Arg.name: Containing_event
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.</def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition: <def-root>This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question how often. It is to be distinguished from Iteration, which pertains simply to the number of times an event occurs-Iteration expressions answer the question how many times. </def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Result</fen> of an surrendering event.</def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: surrender.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give up (a person, right, or possession) on compulsion or demand.

lexUnit.name: relinquish.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: voluntarily cease to keep or claim; give up.

lexUnit.name: give up.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to unwillingly give an item to a recipient
